## Dataset

blah blab [@resende2019]. Mas também [@vieiragomes2018].


::: {.cell}

library(palmerpenguins)
library(tidyverse)

> ::: {.cell}
> 
> ```{.r .cell-code}
> penguins %>%
>   summarise(
>     media_bico = mean(bill_length_mm, na.rm = T),
>     .by = species
>   )
> ```
> 
> ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
> 
> ```
> # A tibble: 3 × 2
>   species   media_bico
>   <fct>          <dbl>
> 1 Adelie          38.8
> 2 Gentoo          47.5
> 3 Chinstrap       48.8
> ```
>

|      |      |      |
|      |      |      |

$$
\nabla
$$ {#eq-lorenz}

We can refer to @eq-lorenz with \`\@\`


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data.frame(
  x = c(rnorm(250, mean = 2), rnorm(250, mean = 0)),
  y = rnorm(500, mean = 0),
  grupo = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 250)
) %>%
  summarize(media = mean(x), .by = grupo)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  grupo       media
1     A  1.99654684
2     B -0.07173645
```


:::
:::
